description: Technicians and administrators alike need tools to diagnose computer problems, centrally manage encryption and recovery keys, provide consistency in user settings, provide application co-existence and more. These are some of the topics that we will tackle in our series on MDOP.
name: Microsoft Desktop Optimization Pack
subtitle: MDOP

episodes.description: Technicians and administrators alike need tools to diagnose computer problems, centrally manage encryption and recovery keys, provide consistency in user settings, provide application co-existence and more. These are some of the topics that we will tackle in our series on MDOP.
episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:03.698 --> 00:00:04.216
We're here

2
00:00:04.216 --> 00:00:07.860
to present to you an overview of
the Microsoft Desktop Optimization Pack.

3
00:00:07.860 --> 00:00:10.260
This is gonna be a new tech
skills show for us, so

4
00:00:10.260 --> 00:00:13.730
that we can actually help you understand
what this product is really all about, and

5
00:00:13.730 --> 00:00:16.410
here to help us out better
is gonna be Mr Wes Bryan.

6
00:00:16.410 --> 00:00:21.060
Wes, who is this particular show really
for, and what topics will we be covering?

7
00:00:21.060 --> 00:00:24.350
>> Well, this is an interesting tech
skill, because one of the things you might

8
00:00:24.350 --> 00:00:29.100
find out there is, there is plenty of, I
would say, textual information about MDOP.

9
00:00:29.100 --> 00:00:33.560
But one of the things it's lacking,
is more video content, and

10
00:00:33.560 --> 00:00:36.380
it is something that,
it does rear its head from time to time.

11
00:00:36.380 --> 00:00:40.190
So this going to be focused on anybody
that wants a little bit better of

12
00:00:40.190 --> 00:00:43.590
an understanding of Microsoft's Enterprise
suite of technologies,

13
00:00:43.590 --> 00:00:47.710
known as
the Microsoft Desktop Optimization Pack.

14
00:00:47.710 --> 00:00:51.370
It helps you to manage things
like the user experience.

15
00:00:51.370 --> 00:00:55.930
For instance, desktop applications, things
like virtualization, as well as managing

16
00:00:55.930 --> 00:00:59.820
a lot of the features that you'll find
inside of your Windows environments.

17
00:00:59.820 --> 00:01:01.790
Keep in mind that the viewer
is gonna be introduced to,

18
00:01:01.790 --> 00:01:03.220
not just a single technology.

19
00:01:03.220 --> 00:01:06.680
I know we call this
Microsoft Desktop Optimization Pack,

20
00:01:06.680 --> 00:01:09.470
but keep in mind it could
also be renamed a toolkit,

21
00:01:09.470 --> 00:01:14.260
because it has many different applications
or products, all bundled into one.

22
00:01:14.260 --> 00:01:18.020
For instance, user experience
virtualization is gonna be one of those

23
00:01:18.020 --> 00:01:21.290
things that we'll be looking at,
sometimes called UEV.

24
00:01:21.290 --> 00:01:24.640
It's a way that I can take settings,
and I can virtualize them, and

25
00:01:24.640 --> 00:01:27.950
have those settings follow me
when I go to different computers.

26
00:01:27.950 --> 00:01:29.330
It's a real handy tool.

27
00:01:29.330 --> 00:01:30.203
Things like AppV.

28
00:01:30.203 --> 00:01:31.230
Maybe you've heard of this.

29
00:01:31.230 --> 00:01:33.100
This is the Application Virtualization.

30
00:01:33.100 --> 00:01:37.510
I need to virtualize an application,
but maybe I don't want to put it into

31
00:01:37.510 --> 00:01:41.200
a hypervisor, and, you know, virtualize
the whole entire operating system.

32
00:01:41.200 --> 00:01:44.990
So this is a good way that you could take
applications, and in a more modular sense,

33
00:01:44.990 --> 00:01:47.660
you can virtualise each
individual one if you need to.

34
00:01:47.660 --> 00:01:50.533
Some of the other topics that
we'll be looking at, is MBAM.

35
00:01:50.533 --> 00:01:53.641
That is, the Microsoft BitLocker,
an administration and

36
00:01:53.641 --> 00:01:55.141
monitoring kit you can use.

37
00:01:55.141 --> 00:01:59.467
It's, maybe you've heard of BitLocker
inside of the Windows operating system,

38
00:01:59.467 --> 00:02:03.975
well, BitLocker, unless you're in group
policy, is kind of a decentralized type of

39
00:02:03.975 --> 00:02:07.770
management system, and it's usually
on a computer to computer basis.

40
00:02:07.770 --> 00:02:11.740
But what this does, the MBAM Software,
is it allows you to scale up to

41
00:02:11.740 --> 00:02:16.170
large enterprises, and
centrally manage BitLocker keys and

42
00:02:16.170 --> 00:02:19.890
BitLocker encryptions that are in
your Enterprise level environment.

43
00:02:19.890 --> 00:02:23.570
We'll look at another tool, that,
one of my personal favorites in the MDOP

44
00:02:23.570 --> 00:02:26.930
platform, is something known as
the Diagnostic and Recovery Toolkit.

45
00:02:26.930 --> 00:02:29.120
And this is a great way that,
like it says,

46
00:02:29.120 --> 00:02:32.470
you can diagnose different problems that
happen inside of the Windows environment.

47
00:02:32.470 --> 00:02:35.230
So, we've got more than just that,
but keep in mind

48
00:02:35.230 --> 00:02:40.240
that some of the topics that you can see
inside of the MDOP series coming up.

49
00:02:40.240 --> 00:02:43.980
>> Now Wes, is there any particular
exam that's associated with this?

50
00:02:43.980 --> 00:02:46.700
Or are we just really talking
about learning the skills itself?

51
00:02:46.700 --> 00:02:49.920
>> I would say the latter's probably gonna
be true, we're gonna be looking more at

52
00:02:49.920 --> 00:02:53.040
the skills that you need, and
just kind of looking at the technology,

53
00:02:53.040 --> 00:02:56.660
not really exam-centric on this one,
but I will throw a word of caution.

54
00:02:56.660 --> 00:03:00.080
One of the things that I've seen, and
if you've taken previous Windows client

55
00:03:00.080 --> 00:03:04.260
certifications, MDOP sometimes
does rear it's head on the exam.

56
00:03:04.260 --> 00:03:08.000
So, while this isn't specific to any
certification, keep in mind any time

57
00:03:08.000 --> 00:03:11.910
you're managing a Windows 10 client
operating system, if you're studying for

58
00:03:11.910 --> 00:03:15.260
that very certification,
this can help to expand your knowledge.

59
00:03:15.260 --> 00:03:17.955
So, if that's something you wanna
know a little bit more about,

60
00:03:17.955 --> 00:03:20.405
the Microsoft Desktop Optimization Pack,
stick around,

61
00:03:20.405 --> 00:03:21.589
cuz we got a lot more to come.

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes begin their Microsoft Desktop Optimization Pack Series by exploring Bitlocker Admin and Monitoring components. This includes the Domain Controller, Management Workstations, Database Server, Administration and Monitoring Server, and MBAM Client.
episodes.title: MBAM Components

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes explain the preplanning steps necessary for the Microsoft Active Directory to work with Bitlocker Administration and Monitoring services. They will look at the user accounts and group roles used to manage the MBAM system. Finally they discuss the Group Policy templates that are downloaded and added for MBAM.
episodes.title: Preparing ADDS for MBAM

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes take you through the installation of the MBAM utility. They begin by explaining the prerequisites that will need to be installed before the MBAM installation can begin. This includes IIS web server service as well as SQL server and ASP .NET frameworks. Finally they are able to walk you through each step to getting MBAM installed.
episodes.title: Installing MBAM

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes show you how to deploy and configure MBAM. They start by getting the client installed on a desktop workstation running Windows 10. Then they go back to the server and configure all the necessary settings through Group Policy. They also walk you through all the GPO settings for MBAM, explaining them as they go.
episodes.title: Deploying and Configuring MBAM

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes explore the actual administration and recovery of end devices using the MBAM administration console. They start by looking at the End User experience. Then they look at the Compliance and Auditing features. Finally, they demonstrate and actual recovery of a client machine.
episodes.title: Administering and Recovery

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes explore the handy tool from Microsoft known as the Diagnostic and Recovery Toolset. They start by explaining what the DaRT is and walk you through setting up the prerequisites for its installation. Then they demonstrate the install of the DaRT system.
episodes.title: Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes continue their look at the Diagnostic and Recovery Toolset. In the previous episode they got it successfully installed, so here they show you how to create a DaRT image and use the DaRT system to remotely access a client PC. They also demonstrate all the tools that come bundled with DaRT.
episodes.title: Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes explore application virtualization with Microsoft's AppV software. Here they explain the concept of application virtualization and the prerequisites for installing the AppV Sequencer. Then they sequence a software program for the purposes of virtualizing on a client computer.
episodes.title: Application Virtualization

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes continue their discussion on Microsoft's AppV. They jump back in by demonstrating the installation of the AppV client and then running the previously sequenced software along side an older version. Finally they look at editing AppV packages and the settings therein.
episodes.title: Application Virtualization Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes introduce you to MDOP's User Experience Virtualization. They begin by describing what UE-V is as well as its similarities and differences to Folder Redirection and/or Roaming Profile. Then they explain all the components of the UE-V system and then move to preparing the environment for the UE-V deployment.
episodes.title: User Experience Virtualization

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes continue demonstrating how to deploy the User Experience Virtualization system. Here they pick up by showing you step-by-step how to install the UE-V Generator. Then they create customized settings location templates. Finally, they configure the UE-V Group Policy settings.
episodes.title: User Experience Virtualization Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes finish demonstrating how to deploy the User Experience Virtualization system. Here they prepare the client computer by installing the UE-V agent. Then they test the UE-V system by changing some settings and checking their persistence. Finally they open up the Company Settings Center and look at the options available there.
episodes.title: User Experience Virtualization Part 3
